When using a theorem or general result from the lecture notes, state the result, instead of quoting the theorem number. For example, write “using det(A) = det(A T )”, instead of “by Theorem 7.10”. 1. Let n ≥ 2 be an integer. Consider the permutation σ : {1, 2, . . . , n} → {1, 2, . . . , n} defined by σ(i) =   i + 1 if i < n, 1 if i = n. (a) Write down σ in the sequence notation, σ = [σ(1), σ(2), . . . , σ(n)]. (b) Find N (σ), the number of inversions in σ. (c) Find σ−1, the inverse of σ. 2. An equivalent description of An is that the 1 st row has 1 in the first and second columns, the nth row has 1 in the (n − 1) th and nth columns, and the i th row for i = 2, 3, . . . , n − 1 has 1 in the (i − 1) th, ith and (i + 1)th columns, while every other element is 0. (a) Write down A2 and find det(A2). (b) Write down A3 and find det(A3). (c) For n ≥ 4, show that det(An) = det(An−1) − det(An−2), and hence, show that det(An+1) = − det(An−2). (d) Find det(An) when: (i) n = 3k − 1 for some integer k ≥ 1; (ii) n = 3k for some integer k ≥ 1; (iii) n = 3k + 1 for some integer k ≥ 1. 2
